page.title: 05CLUBS AND SOCIETIES
page.content: Our village provides a wide variety of clubs and societies for people to use.There are several sports clubs, for example, bowls, tennis, football, judo and gymnastics. There are youth clubs such as Cubs, Brownies and Guides, Sunday school and Pathfinders, which is for children too old for Sunday school. There are also organisations like the Women's Institute. Clubs are mainly for older people in the village, like the Social Club, Bingo, Tennis, Bowls and W.I.. Clubs make themselves money and get more people to join by holding disco dances, jumble sales, coffee mornings, sponsored walks and bowls drives. The Cubs, Brownies and Guides are held in the old hut near the war memorial, and most of the others are held in the Village Hall.
